speed_report.description: Lines reporting the player's current speed in km/h. {speed} is replaced with the number.
lines: Your speed is {speed} kilometers per hour

direction_report.description: Lines reporting the player's current direction. {direction} is replaced with a direction (e.g., north).

highest_paying_job.description: Lines reporting the highest paying job available. {job_type} is replaced with the type of job, {destination} with the destination, and {payout} with the payout amount.
lines: The highest paying job is: {job_type} to {destination} at a rate of {rounded_payout} dollars.
If you want a good payout, consider taking {job_type} to {destination} for {rounded_payout} dollars.
{rounded_payout} dollars are on the table for {job_type} to {destination}.
Chasing profits? {job_type} to {destination} is your ticket to {rounded_payout} dollars.
Top of the board: {job_type} to {destination} with a reward of {rounded_payout} dollars.

derailment.description: Lines that play when the player derails the train. These lines are meant to be humorous and sarcastic.
lines: Well, would you look at that, physics won this round again.
You've really outdone yourself this time. Hope you weren't too attached to that train.
I did say, slow down! But hey, what do I know, I'm just the dispatcher.
I'll start the paperwork again. You better buy me a drink after this.
Congratulations! You've successfully demonstrated how NOT to drive a train.

station_office_entry.description: Lines that play when the player enters the station office.
lines: Welcome to the {yard_name} station office, make yourself comfortable.
It's always a pleasure to see you at the {yard_name} office.
Enjoy your stay at the {yard_name} station office.

yard_entry.description: Lines that play when the player enters a yard area.

yard_exit.description: Lines that play when the player exits a yard area.

transport_job_overview.description: A full job overview when accepting a new freight haul or logistical haul job.
lines: {job_type_name}. Pick up {car_count} from track {starting_track_name} in {starting_yard_name}. Deliver them to {destination_yard_name}. Then drop them off at track {destination_track_name}.

shunting_load_job_overview.description: A full job overview when accepting a new shunting load job.

lines: {job_type_name}. Couple {pickup_1_car_count} at track {pickup_1_track_name}. Then load at track {loading_track_name}. Then uncouple at track {destination_track_name} to complete the order.

{job_type_name}. Couple {pickup_1_car_count} at track {pickup_1_track_name}, and {pickup_2_car_count} at track {pickup_2_track_name}. Then load {destination_car_count} at track {loading_track_name}. Then uncouple at track {destination_track_name} to complete the order.

{job_type_name}. Couple {pickup_1_car_count} at track {pickup_1_track_name}, {pickup_2_car_count} at track {pickup_2_track_name}, and {pickup_3_car_count} at track {pickup_3_track_name}. Then load {destination_car_count} at track {loading_track_name}. Then uncouple at track {destination_track_name} to complete the order.

default.description: A job with a high number of pickups.
lines: {job_type_name}. It has {number_of_pickups} pickups, and with that I wish you luck. Load those {destination_car_count} at track {loading_track_name}. Then uncouple at track {destination_track_name} to complete the order.

shunting_unload_job_overview.description: A full job overview when accepting a new shunting unload job.

lines: {job_type_name}. Pick up {starting_car_count} at track {starting_track_name}. Then unload at track {unloading_track_name}. Then uncouple at track {dropoff_1_track_name} to complete the order.

{job_type_name}. Pick up {starting_car_count} at track {starting_track_name}. Then unload at track {unloading_track_name}. Then uncouple {dropoff_1_car_count} at track {dropoff_1_track_name}, and {dropoff_2_car_count} at track {dropoff_2_track_name} to complete the order.

{job_type_name}. Pick up {starting_car_count} at track {starting_track_name}. Then unload at track {unloading_track_name}. Then uncouple {dropoff_1_car_count} at track {dropoff_1_track_name}, {dropoff_2_car_count} at track {dropoff_2_track_name}, and {dropoff_3_car_count} at track {dropoff_3_track_name} to complete the order.

default.description: A job with a high number of dropoffs.
lines: {job_type_name}. It has {number_of_dropoffs} dropoffs, and with that I wish you luck. Pick up {starting_car_count} at track {starting_track_name}. Then unload at track {unloading_track_name}. Then uncouple at a bunch of different tracks to complete the order.

generic_job_task.description: Sentence of an overview for a job that is not a typical type (modded).

lines: Move {car_count} from track {starting_track_name} to track {destination_track_name} in {destination_yard_name}.
Move {car_count} from track {starting_track_name} in {starting_yard_name} to track {destination_track_name} in {destination_yard_name}.

you_have_n_orders.description: A sentence that says the player has a certain number of orders.

car_count.description: Number followed by 'cars' in the proper plural form.

car_count_russian_example.description: Number followed by 'cars' in the proper plural form in Russian.

track_name.description: Maps the name of a track. Should be short like 'Alfa 1'. Example yard_id=HB, sub_yard_id=B, order_number=3, track_type=M

parametrization_test.description: Lines used for testing the parametrization of the mod. These lines are not meant to be used in the game.

alfa.description: This is a test line for param1=alfa.
lines: Apple: Param 1 is set to {param1}, param 2 is {param2}, and param 3 is {param3}.

bravo.description: This is a test line for param1=bravo.
lines: Banana: Param 1 is set to {param1}, param 2 is {param2}, and param 3 is {param3}.

charlie.description: This is a test line for param1=charlie.

delta.description: This is a test line for param1=charlie and param2=delta.
lines: Citron: Param 1 is {param1}, param 2 is {param2}, and param 3 is {param3}.

echo.description: This is a test line for param1=charlie and param2=echo.
lines: Dandelion: Param 1 is {param1}, param 2 is {param2}, and param 3 is {param3}.

.*nana.description: This is a test line for param1 ending with 'nana'.

default.description: This is a catch-all test line for any other value of param1.
lines: Catch-all: Param 1 is set to {param1}, param 2 is {param2}, and param 3 is {param3}.

yard_id.description: Takes the yard ID and returns the full name of the yard.

job_type.description: Takes the job type ID and returns the full name of a single instance of job type order.
